content: Which American author is best known for his novels The Adventures of Tom Sawyer and its sequel, Adventures of Huckleberry Finn?

The American author best known for his novels "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer" and its sequel, "Adventures of Huckleberry Finn," is Mark Twain. His real name was Samuel Langhorne Clemens, and he was born on November 30, 1835, in Florida, Missouri. Twain is often referred to as the "father of American literature" and is renowned for his use of humor, satire, and local color in his writing. His works not only entertain but also provide insight into the culture and society of the United States during the 19th century, particularly in the Southern regions along the Mississippi River.
